content.description: Fantastic sustained pulling with great movement and interesting features. What's not to like!
content.location: 3rd route from the left of wall.

content.description: Scramble up a ledge ten feet up to start on the slabby left face. The steep right face will keep forcing you left. Halfway in, the exposure begins and by the finish you'll be 50 feet from the cliff base near the top of the giant amphitheater.
content.protection: bolted anchors, normal rack up to #4
content.location: The midmost of three right facing dihedrals on the far right side.

content.description: Steep easy jugs but with a lot of holds still breaking. Not bad but you've been warned.
content.location: Walk through the swampy area about 200 feet towards the right side of Cloud 9, or walk left from the Infirmary along the rough cliffside trail.

content.description: Technical face climb with some powerful movement in the bottom section.
content.location: In between Douche Canoe (11d) and Fight Test (12b).

content.description: Fun, bouldery hard start with a hard bulge move a couple bolts later. Mostly vertical
content.location: Last route on the far right side of Cloud 9

content.description: Follow the left angling obtuse dihedral with small face holds on the left. Use the crack and anything you can find when the holds get smaller near the top. Climbs better than it may look.
content.protection: Medium to small gear, shares anchors with sport route to left
content.location: 15 feet right of Rough Around the Edges is this right facing dihedral that angles up and left.

content.description: Less steeper than the routes to the right but still the bouldery start the Red is known for. Slab crux in the middle.
content.location: Currently the first bolted route on the left

content.description: Follow large holds trending right to a steep, hard finish
Good movement on interesting holds and pockets with engaging crux guarding the chains. Hand jamming skills could come in useful.
content.location: Second Route on the left of wall.

content.description: Sustained climbing on mostly positive edges and jugs. Powerful down low with longer moves lead to resistance climbing punctuated by decent shakes.
content.location: Right of Over Shadowed (12b), left of Stratus Fear (11d). Stratus Fear is the only line on this cliff with perma-draws, so it's a good point of reference.

content.description: Boulder up a slab with a cracked block on top to a ledge, then follow the slabby dihedral angling up and left.
content.protection: Mostly small to medium gear with bolted anchors
content.location: About 60 feet right of Nightmare on Hell Creek or 60 feet left of the end of Cloud 9.

content.description: A pumpy jug haul with a red point crux near the top. Enjoy a much needed rest the small hueco before making the final moves to the chains
Start on top of cheater stones on a large boulder. Getting past a mantel move to a sloping ledge gets you to big jugs up the rest of the climb.
content.location: A few feet right of Better than a Stick in the Eye

content.description: Mostly vertical with a slightly steeper finish. Not too many jugs here but still good quality hardness.
content.location: The left of two sport routes at the far right side of Cloud 9

climbs.name: Cloudy with a Chance of Seamen

content.description: High quality rock and movement. Recommended to clip the second bolt to get through the difficult bouldery start.
content.location: Currently the 4th bolted route from the left side

climbs.name: Better than a Stick in the Eye

content.description: Long and steep but not as stellar as the routes to the left
content.location: Left of a large boulder on the edge of a swampy area
